message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

This paper proposes a family of differentiable image-to-image mappings that improve the robustness of models towards pre-defined continuous transformation groups. The paper focuses on image classification tasks and proposes a new architecture that incorporates prior knowledge on the transformation invariances of a domain. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper proposes a new neural network architecture, which is related to machine learning and deep learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also discusses the use of canonical coordinate systems, which is related to mathematical foundations, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on a real-world image classification task, which is related to natural language processing, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) a less likely but still possible sub-category.
